Key Match Events: A goalkeeping error by Bailey Peacock-Farrell gifted Kiril Despodov the only goal of the game.
Ciaron Brown blocked an early shot on the line amid a goalmouth scramble.
Radoslav Kirilov hit a post with a fine free-kick.
Aleksandar Kolev set up an easy finish for home captain Kiril Despodov.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael O’Neill acknowledged the physicality and power of the Bulgarian team before the match.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael O’Neill admitted the nature of Bulgaria’s winning goal made Northern Ireland’s 1-0 defeat in Plovdiv all the more frustrating.
O’Neill noted that the poor pitch conditions affected both teams and contributed to the game's physicality.
O’Neill reflected on the decision-making in their own half and acknowledged Bailey Peacock-Farrell's mistake as the deciding factor in the game.
O’Neill mentioned that Northern Ireland had more possession in the second half but struggled to create chances as Bulgaria defended their lead.
O’Neill emphasized that the players are learning and that there were positives to take from the game despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions were poor and began cutting up almost as soon as the game started, hampering the flow of the match.
